subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
Unorthodox variant {{Han simp|難|nocap=y}} (elimination of left component to {{l|zh|又}}) found in the Ming dynasty orthographic dictionary <big>《俗書刊誤》</big>. <!-- Refer http://dict.variants.moe.edu.tw/variants/rbt/word_attribute.rbt?educode=A04467-046#33 -->

Originally part of the 324 simplified characters introduced by the {{w|Republic of China}} ({{w|Kuomintang}} government) in 1935 but was later retracted in 1936. <!-- Refer https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:ROC24_SC2.jpg -->

Eventually adopted as an official simplified character by the People's Republic of China in the 1956 {{w|Chinese Character Simplification Scheme}}. <!-- Refer https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/漢字簡化方案 -->
